image.altText: Watercolour map of Australia showing low amounts of rainfall across the country with ocean in background.

props.synopsis: It was Peruvian fishermen, hundreds of years ago, who first noticed and named El Niño. Little did they realise they had named one of the most consequential climate drivers on Earth. This is how it works.

title.children: Understanding El Niño, the most consequential climate driver on Earth

image.altText: Khalistan flags are seen outside the Guru Nanak Sikh Gurdwara Sahib in Surrey, British Columbia.

props.synopsis: Canada and India have expelled each other's top diplomats in last 24 hours. Here's why Australia is 'deeply concerned'.

title.children: Canada and India are at odds over the Khalistan movement. But what is it and why is Australia 'concerned'?

image.altText: Man in cap working on a green car.

props.synopsis: Powercruising fans insist the death-defying sport is safe despite the death of one Queensland racer.

title.children: Kyle is addicted to driving fast cars. Even if that means facing death

image.altText: Yevgeny Prigozhin with his wife and daughter

props.synopsis: When Prigozhin staged a mutiny against Putin's military, he effectively signed his own death warrant. But what happens to his wife and children?

title.children: Before he died in a fiery crash, Prigozhin's family lived a life of opulence. Now they have a choice

image.altText: Five people smile at camera with security vests on.

props.synopsis: When fly-in fly-out security had little success engaging with Mornington Island's young people, residents decided to take matters into their own hands.

title.children: This island's residents are doing night patrols to combat youth crime — and it's working

image.altText: A helicopter-looking drone takes off from a ship flight deck

props.synopsis: Australia quietly cancels plans to buy reconnaissance drones used by China and Russia under a $1 billion Navy project controversially approved just days before last year's election by then defence minister Peter Dutton.

title.children: Labor scraps Peter Dutton's billion-dollar military drone plan

image.altText: A heart-shaped pink diamond held by tweezers under a magnifying glass

props.synopsis: Pink Argyle diamonds were created some 1.3 billion years ago, when a chunk of an ancient supercontinent started splitting apart, violently blasting hot rock carrying the precious stones to the surface, new research suggests.

title.children: WA's pink diamonds may be a symbol of love, but it took a violent split a billion years ago to bring them to light

image.altText: Man with beard standing on beach

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian company developing seaweed supplements to reduce cow farts and burps is recognised by a prestigious environmental prize set-up by Prince William and Sir David Attenborough.

title.children: Plan to tackle cow farts and burps catches attention of Prince William-backed prize

image.altText: In a light room filled with shelves of ceramics, a smiling woman paints a vase and smiling man molds clay on wheel.

props.synopsis: Hobbies aren't just activities to pass the time. They can boost your mental health and sense of purpose. These experts say it's time to take them more seriously.

title.children: Want some more pleasure in your day? A hobby could be your answer. Here's how to find – and keep – one

image.altText: A primary school aged white girl in a green and yellow uniform smiles excitedly while seated holding a cello.

props.synopsis: This music program for kids as young as six is proven to boost literacy, numeracy and attitude to schooling - and it may be coming to a public school near you.

title.children: How this Western Sydney public school turned students' academic performance around with music

image.altText: Jim Chalmers stands in a courtyard at parliament house.

props.synopsis: New economic forecasts are painting a bleak picture for the world's economy in 2024, dragged down by persistent inflation and ongoing problems in China.

title.children: World economy forecast to slow further, dragged down by high inflation and a troubled China

image.altText: Lynda Goymour with son Mitchell looking up a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A wheelchair taxi shortage continues taking a toll on members of the disability community in northern Tasmania, with a mum saying her son's health has deteriorated after having to cancel numerous specialist appointments due to the taxis' unreliability.

title.children: 'We just can't rely on the taxis to turn up': Life made that much harder for Mitchell and mum Lynda

image.altText: Man in a cowboy hat looks to the side

props.synopsis: Willie Arthur Mareko has been jailed, for what the judge described as "truly horrendous" behaviour, after he commissioned live streams of depraved acts being performed on children in the Philippines.

title.children: Hamilton Island man jailed for 14 years after soliciting sexual acts on Filipino children

image.altText: Russel Brand sits on the backseat of a car wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: The video streaming site says that Russell Brand will no longer make money from his videos after several women made allegations of sexual assault against the comedian-turned-influencer.

title.children: YouTube suspends Russell Brand's account from making money following sexual assault claims

image.altText: a close-up of a person's hand holding a chicken and salad sandwich made with white bread

props.synopsis: Listeria is an opportunistic infection so not everyone will get sick if they eat food with the bacteria. But it's particularly problematic for pregnant women, the elderly and people with chronic illness.

title.children: A listeria outbreak has been recorded in three states. Here are some ways you can avoid it

image.altText: A centrelink sign with on a building with a reflection

props.synopsis: Income support base rate increases promised in this year's federal budget will come into action today.

title.children: JobSeeker, Age Pension and Youth Allowance are among Centrelink payments increasing today. Here's how much and why

image.altText: Milk on supermarket shelf showing price

props.synopsis: As consumers adjust to the impact of the rising cost of living, Coles has increased its own-brand milk price by 10 cents per litre. But for farmers, it feels like redemption.

title.children: Why Coles has 'reluctantly' raised the price of its milk this week

image.altText: Sector commander stands facing a controlled burn

props.synopsis: A day after El Niño was formally declared by the Bureau of Meteorology, fire bans are in place as hot and dry conditions are forecast across New South Wales.

title.children: 'Extreme' fire danger warnings for Sydney, Hunter regions as record hot weather persists

image.altText: A large explosion on a hill in Karabakh.

props.synopsis: Fears of a fresh war have been building in recent months, with Armenia accusing Azerbaijan of a troop build-up and decrying a blockade of its only land link to Nagorno-Karabakh.

title.children: Blasts in Karabakh as Azerbaijan launches 'anti-terrorist' military operation

image.altText: Danushka Gunathilaka outside court

props.synopsis: A woman who alleges she was "stealthed" by the Sri Lankan international cricketer told friends "something switched in him" once they started having sex, a Sydney court has heard.

title.children: Cricketer Danushka Gunathilaka 'turned into an animal' during sex with Sydney woman, court told

image.altText: Dams containing small amounts of water can be seen in drought-affected farming area located west of Melbourne,

props.synopsis: One of the world's most consequential climate drivers, El Niño, is underway for the first time in eight years, according to Australia's Bureau of Meteorology.

title.children: BOM officially declares El Niño, warns of extreme heat risk over spring and summer

image.altText: a person in an Akubra hat silhouetted against an Indigenous flag

props.synopsis: A far-right US media figure who has made racist attacks on Indigenous Australians spoke at a conservative conference chaired by leading No campaigner Warren Mundine.

title.children: Far-right US podcaster spoke at conservative conference chaired by Warren Mundine

image.altText: Flowers and teddy on the side of the road

props.synopsis: Court documents allege Izak Kane Sefton-Bennett had a loaded rifle in the car and drove while under the influence of drugs when involved in a crash that killed Queensland aged care worker Christella Tan last week.

title.children: Fatal Sunshine Coast crash driver had loaded gun, methamphetamines, court documents allege

image.altText: Woman with arms crossed and head down.

props.synopsis: Crown prosecutors have told a jury they intend to bring evidence that proves a Queensland mother failed to supervise her two children before they drowned.

title.children: Mother 'unaware' sons left yard to play unsupervised before drowning, court hears

image.altText: Referee Ashley Klein points during the 2022 NRL grand final.

props.synopsis: For the first time in four years, leading NRL referee Ashley Klein will not take charge of a preliminary final after two major errors in last week's semifinal.

title.children: Leading NRL referee dropped for preliminary finals after clear errors in Storm-Roosters clash

image.altText: A shopping centre carpark

props.synopsis: Thieves order young girl from running, unlocked car in Bundaberg before dumping the vehicle in nearby Thabeban, police say.

title.children: 11yo girl 'quite traumatised' after car stolen by thieves

image.altText: A woman on a sporting field looking on

props.synopsis: Jenni Hermoso says the federation's decision to call up nearly half of the 39 players who said they would not play for the national team as a protest, was "irrefutable proof" that "nothing has changed".

title.children: Jenni Hermoso accuses Spain's soccer federation of threatening World Cup-winning players

image.altText: paddle wheeler pride of the murray on land

props.synopsis: The paddle wheeler successfully cruised the Thomson River for a few months in 2022 after being trucked 1,700 kilometres from central Victoria but sank in March.

title.children: Pride of the Murray will not cruise again but owner says 'it's not the end'

image.altText: A search and rescue worker in burnt Lahaina

props.synopsis: As Australia experiences "bigger … hotter fires", experts say buffel grass — which is now found in every state and territory — poses a growing bushfire risk.

title.children: Invasive grass with role in deadly Maui blaze 'absolutely a threat' to Australian lives

image.altText: The Google app displayed on a smartphone, next to the US flag outside a Department of Justice building.

props.synopsis: The US government has told a federal court that Google has exploited its position as "the gatekeeper of the internet" to destroy competition.

title.children: The US has taken Google to court for allegedly rigging the internet search market. Here's what has happened so far

image.altText: Flames and smoke in scrubland at the edge of a road.

props.synopsis: The fire danger warning for the NSW Far South Coast is upgraded to catastrophic as the state endures a day of hot and windy weather.

title.children: Far South Coast fire danger upgraded to catastrophic as schools close, hot and windy conditions persist

image.altText: Smoke plume over coast line.

props.synopsis: Firefighters are still working to control a blaze near the popular holiday town of Coles Bay on Tasmania's east coast. Severe winds have eased but the road into the town is still closed until it can be made safe.

title.children: Bushfire warnings downgraded but Tasmanian tourist town still cut off after fire prompts evacuations

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wearing a black hoodie with the "yes" logo on the front.

props.synopsis: Supporters of the Voice to Parliament, including Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and SA Premier Peter Malinauskas have called out protesters who targeted a major No campaign event in Adelaide.

title.children: Prime minister calls for 'respectful' debate after protesters target No campaign event

image.altText: A relaxed young man wears an open-collared shirt and looks left of the camera, a lamp and door behind him are out of focus

props.synopsis: When Senator Steele-John became the youngest-ever senator, he put his new paycheque toward removing "that knot of fear in the stomach" that came with his family's debt.

title.children: Jordon Steele-John on how paying down his family's debt was a 'privilege'
